content.prompt: A solid cylinder with known radius is rolling while slipping along a horizontal surface, as shown. The center of mass of the cylinder is moving to the right and slowing down, and the cylinder is rotating in a counterclockwise direction. At the instant shown, the speed of the center of mass of the cylinder is vcm and the angular speed of the cylinder is ω. Can the relationship between vcm and ω be determined? Why or why not?

choices.label: Yes, because vcm=rω.
Yes, because the linear acceleration of the center of mass is related to the angular acceleration by acm=rα.
No, because the friction force dissipates an unknown amount of energy from the cylinder-surface system.
No, because when an object is slipping, the motion of the center of mass and the rotational motion of the object are not related.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
